item.title: 政府称印度索姆酒厂童工每天工作 11 小时
item.description: 印度邦政府对索姆集团（Som Group）的一家酒厂进行检查时发现，一些年龄在 13 至 17 岁之间的童工被强迫灌装和包装酒瓶，而且工作时间很长。【原文：An Indian state government's inspection of a Som Group distillery said child labourers, some aged between 13 and 17, were made to fill and pack liquor bottles and worked long hours.】

item.title: 聚焦：德国工业在削减能源成本的竞赛中转向太阳能
item.description: 几个月来，菲利普-马蒂亚斯一直试图说服父亲在他们位于德国东部图林根州的公司屋顶上安装太阳能电池板，以降低这家金属制品厂的电费和碳排放。【原文：For months, Philip Matthias tried to convince his father to install solar panels on their company's roof in the eastern German state of Thuringia, aiming to cut electricity costs and carbon emissions at the metal products factory.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，日本主要保险公司将出售 31 亿美元的本田股份
item.description: 日本四家最大的财产保险公司和其他金融公司计划出售约 5000 亿日元（31 亿美元）的本田汽车股份，三位知情人士称，这是因为交叉持股做法的解禁正在加速。【原文：Four of Japan's top property and casualty insurers and other financial firms plan to sell around 500 billion yen ($3.1 billion) of shares in Honda Motor , three people said, as the unwinding of cross-shareholding practices accelerates.】

item.title: 法国餐饮集团索迪斯第三季度销售额不及预期
item.description: 法国餐饮企业索迪斯周二公布的第三季度销售额略低于预期，原因是该公司改变了与世界其他地区的一份大型合同相关的项目工程的核算方式。【原文：French food caterer Sodexo reported slightly lower than expected third-quarter sales on Tuesday, citing a change in how it accounts for project works related to a large contract in its Rest of the World segment.】

item.title: Wunsch 说，欧洲央行下一次降息是在选择变得困难之前的一个简单决定
item.description: 欧洲央行决策者皮埃尔-温施在接受采访时表示，欧洲央行下一次降息仍是一个相对容易的决定，但只有在通胀率明确迈向2%的目标时，才应采取后续举措。【原文：The European Central Bank's next interest rate cut is still a relatively easy decision, but subsequent moves should only come once inflation is clearly heading towards the 2% target, ECB policymaker Pierre Wunsch said in an interview.】

item.title: 中国比亚迪电动汽车季度销量大增 21%，缩小与特斯拉的差距
item.description: 中国比亚迪第二季度电动汽车销量增长了 21%，缩小了与特斯拉的差距，而特斯拉在第一季度将全球第一大电动汽车供应商的头衔拱手让给了中国比亚迪。【原文：China's BYD posted a 21% rise in second-quarter electric vehicle sales, closing the gap with Tesla after handing back the world's top EV vendor title to the U.S. rival in the first quarter.】

item.title: 意大利企业通过自学弥补技能差距
item.description: 29 岁的费德里科-奥利维耶里（Federico Olivieri）多年来一直从事非正式的农场工人工作，当一个巨大的建筑工地出现在他位于西西里岛的家旁边时，他简直不敢相信，这个建筑工地提供了大量所需的专业工作培训。【原文：After years of informal work as a farm labourer, Federico Olivieri, 29, could not believe it when a huge building site appeared next to his home in Sicily with training on offer for the numerous specialised jobs required.】

item.title: 网络泡沫的回声萦绕着人工智能驱动的美国股市
item.description: 人们对人工智能的热情推动美股大涨，这与二十年前的网络泡沫形成了鲜明对比，让人怀疑股价是否再次被对革命性技术的乐观情绪推高。【原文：A U.S. stock rally supercharged by excitement over artificial intelligence is drawing comparisons with the dotcom bubble two decades ago, raising the question of whether prices have again been inflated by optimism over a revolutionary technology.】

item.title: 解读：中国计划出台的金融稳定法是什么？
item.description: 作为中国政府在全球第二大经济体防范系统性金融风险的广泛努力的一部分，中国即将公布金融稳定法，其中包括设立一个基金来拯救陷入困境的金融机构。【原文：China is moving closer to unveiling its financial stability law, which includes setting up a fund to rescue troubled financial institutions, as part of Beijing's broader efforts to prevent systemic financial risks in the world's second-biggest economy.】

item.title: 早间竞标极右翼竞争对手的抉择日
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 大型开发商销售额降幅缩小，中国房地产企业跳涨
item.description: 周二，在香港上市的中国房地产公司股价大涨，此前有私人数据显示，6 月份中国主要房地产开发商的年销售额降幅继续收窄。【原文：Shares in Hong Kong-listed Chinese property companies surged on Tuesday, after private data showed yearly sales declines for major Chinese property developers continued to narrow in June.】

item.title: 金融时报》称，西门子能源计划为电网部门招聘 1 万名员工
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周二报道，西门子能源公司计划为其电网业务招聘 1 万多名新员工，到 2030 年，该业务将成为该能源工程集团最大的收入来源。【原文：Siemens Energy plans to recruit more than 10,000 new employees for its electricity grid business, set to be the energy engineering group's largest revenue driver by 2030, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚澳新银行因向死亡客户收费而受到制裁
item.description: 澳大利亚银行业合规委员会周二表示，澳新银行集团因未能停止或退还已故客户的费用，以及未在规定时间内回复已故客户的代表而受到制裁。【原文：ANZ Group has been sanctioned for failing to stop or refund fees for dead customers and for not responding to representatives of customers who have passed away within a required time frame, Australia's Banking Code Compliance Committee said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 力拓谈判避免蒙古铜矿罢工
item.description: 全球矿业公司力拓正在与蒙古奥尤陶勒盖铜矿的工人进行谈判，以避免因工资大幅下降引发进一步的劳工行动。【原文：Global miner Rio Tinto is negotiating with workers at its Oyu Tolgoi copper operations in Mongolia to avert further industrial action over a sharp drop in wages that triggered an earlier strike in May.】

item.title: 特朗普风险提振美国收益率，美元飙升逼近 38 年来的日元峰值
item.description: 周二，在国债收益率飙升之后，美元兑日元汇率徘徊在近 38 年的高点附近，因为投资者在考虑唐纳德-特朗普可能第二次担任总统。【原文：The U.S. dollar hovered near an almost 38-year high to the yen on Tuesday following a surge in Treasury yields as investors contemplated the potential for a second Donald Trump presidency.】

item.title: 日本财务大臣称将对外汇走势保持警惕
item.description: 日本财务大臣铃木俊一周二表示，日本当局将对货币市场走势保持警惕，因为日元继续下跌，创下了 38 年来的新低。【原文：Japanese authorities will remain vigilant to currency market moves, finance minister Shunichi Suzuki said on Tuesday, as the yen continued its downturn to fresh 38-year lows.】

item.title: 微软整合中国零售渠道
item.description: 据媒体报道，微软正在关闭其在中国大陆的授权实体零售商网络，对此，微软表示正在整合其在中国大陆的零售渠道。【原文：Microsoft is consolidating its retail channels in mainland China, the firm said in response to media reports that it is closing its network of authorised physical retailers in the world's second-largest economy.】

item.title: 石油维持在两个月高位附近，原因是需求前景看好，可能降息
item.description: 周二，油价变化不大，维持在上一交易日触及的两个月高点附近，原因是人们预期夏季旅游旺季将带来燃料需求的增长，而且美国可能降息，这将促进经济增长。【原文：Oil prices were little changed on Tuesday, holding near the two-month highs reached in the previous session, on expectations for rising fuel demand from the summer travel season and possible U.S. interest rate cuts that could boost economic growth.】

item.title: 澳大利亚给互联网公司 6 个月时间起草在线儿童安全规则
item.description: 澳大利亚监管机构周二表示，澳大利亚将给互联网行业六个月的时间来制定可执行的规范，详细说明如何阻止儿童在网上看到色情和其他不适当的材料，否则将面临被强制执行规范的命运。【原文：Australia is giving the internet industry six months to come up with an enforceable code detailing how it will stop children seeing pornography and other inappropriate material online or face having a code imposed on it, a regulator said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行在维持利率不变时看到了就业的下行风险
item.description: 路透社悉尼7月2日电）澳大利亚央行在6月份的政策会议上考虑了是否需要进一步提高利率以抑制通胀，但决定维持现状，部分原因是劳动力市场存在急剧放缓的风险。【原文：SYDNEY, July 2 (Reuters) - Australia's central bank pondered whether a further rise in interest rates was needed to bring inflation to heel at its June policy meeting, but decided to stand pat in part due to the risk of a sharp slowdown in the labour market.】

item.title: 美国收益率提振美元，日元却萎靡不振
item.description: 美元受到美国收益率上升的支撑，周二中国的人民币和日本的日元等低收益货币受到打击，日元跌至1986年以来的最低点。【原文：The dollar was supported by rising U.S. yields and the blowtorch was on low-yielding currencies on Tuesday such as China's yuan and Japan's yen, which was pinned to its lowest since 1986.】

item.title: 工会官员称韩国三星电子工会将于 7 月 8 日至 10 日罢工
item.description: 一位工会官员周二表示，三星电子的一个工会将在 7 月 8 日至 10 日之间举行罢工，以加强针对这家韩国最强大企业集团的工业行动。【原文：A workers' union at Samsung Electronics will strike between July 8 and 10, an union official said on Tuesday, as it steps up industrial action against the country's most powerful conglomerate.】

item.title: 新西兰将继续实施媒体内容付费法
item.description: 新西兰保守派联合政府周二表示，将继续实施一项法案，强制要求数字技术平台向媒体公司支付新闻费用。【原文：New Zealand's conservative coalition government will proceed with a bill that would make it compulsory for digital technology platforms to pay media companies for news, it said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 据《日经新闻》报道，Blackstone 将以 22 亿美元的价格向 MBK 出售日本补充剂制造商 Alinamin
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周二报道，私募股权投资公司 Blackstone 将以 3,500 亿日元（21.7 亿美元）的价格把日本制药商 Alinamin Pharmaceutical 出售给北亚收购基金 MBK Partners。【原文：Private equity firm Blackstone is to sell Japanese drugmaker Alinamin Pharmaceutical to North Asian buyout fund MBK Partners for 350 billion yen ($2.17 billion) the Nikkei newspaper reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: Salesforce 股东否决首席执行官和其他高管的薪酬计划
item.description: 根据周一提交的一份安全文件，Salesforce 大多数股东投票反对其首席执行官马克-贝尼奥夫（Marc Benioff）和其他高管的薪酬计划。【原文：A majority of Salesforce shareholders voted against a compensation plan for its CEO Marc Benioff and other top executives, according to a security filing on Monday.】

item.title: 供应压力缓解，韩国通胀率创 11 个月新低
item.description: 周二的官方数据显示，由于供应方压力减轻，韩国6月份的消费者通胀率降至11个月来的最低点，低于市场预期，令政策制定者稍感宽慰。【原文：South Korea's consumer inflation weakened to an 11-month low in June as supply-side pressures eased, official data showed on Tuesday, coming in below market expectations and providing some relief for policymakers.】

item.title: 零售商称英国商店价格通胀为 2021 年 10 月以来最弱
item.description: 据行业数据显示，上个月英国商店的物价上涨速度是近三年来最慢的，这凸显了通货膨胀的降温，尽管首相苏纳克（Rishi Sunak）在本周的全国大选中不太可能看到太多的好处。【原文：Prices in British shops rose at the slowest pace in almost three years last month, according to industry figures that underscore how inflation has cooled even if Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is unlikely to see much benefit in this week's national election.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局因交通管制人员配备问题放慢纽瓦克机场航班速度
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）周一表示，由于一个控制中心的交通管制人员配备问题，进出纽瓦克机场的航班将放缓。【原文：Flights into and out of Newark airport, that serves many New Yorkers, will be slowed due to traffic controller staffing issues at a control center, the Federal Aviation Administration said on Monday.】

item.title: 制药商要求终止善达癌症诉讼的上诉遭法官驳回
item.description: 美国特拉华州的一名法官驳回了葛兰素史克公司和其他制药商提出的上诉请求，该判决允许 70,000 多起声称胃灼热药善达克（Zantac）致癌的诉讼继续进行。【原文：A Delaware judge rebuffed a request by GSK and other drugmakers to appeal a ruling allowing more than 70,000 lawsuits claiming that the heartburn drug Zantac caused cancer to go forward.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体在年度更新后加入罗素指数
item.description: 拥有社交媒体平台 Truth Social 的 Trump Media & Technology Group 周一表示，作为罗素指数年度重组的一部分，该公司已被纳入罗素指数。【原文：Trump Media & Technology Group , which owns social media platform Truth Social, said on Monday it has been added to the Russell Indexes as part of their annual reconstitution.】
